name: documentsection
description: Divides a PDF document into sections.

params.name: marginbottom
params.description:
Specifies the bottom margin in inches (default) or centimeters.

To specify the bottom margin in centimeters, include the unit="cm" attribute in the parent cfdocument tag.

params.name: marginleft
params.description:
Specifies the left margin in inches (default) or
centimeters. To specify the left margin in centimeters,
include the unit="cm" attribute in the parent cfdocument
tag.

params.name: marginright
params.description:
Specifies the right margin in inches (default) or
centimeters. To specify the right margin in centimeters,
include the unit="cm" attribute in the parent cfdocument
tag.

params.name: margintop
params.description:
Specifies the top margin in inches (default) or
centimeters. To specify the top margin in centimeters,
include the unit="cm" attribute in the parent cfdocument
tag.

params.name: orientation
params.description: Page orientation. Can be "landscape" or "portrait". Defaults to the orientation of the enclosing `<cfdocument>`.

params.name: src
params.description: define a url or a relative path on the local system to a file that should be transferred to a pdf

params.name: srcfile
params.description: define an absolute path to a file that should be transferred to a pdf

params.name: mimetype
params.description: mimetype of the source (when attribute src or srcfile are defined)

params.name: authuser
params.description: User name sent to the target URL for Basic Authentication. Combined with password to form a base64 encoded string that is passed in the Authenticate header. Does not provide support for Integrated Windows, NTLM, or Kerberos authentication.

params.name: authpassword
params.description: Password sent to the target URL for Basic Authentication. Combined with username to form a base64 encoded string that is passed in the Authenticate header. Does not provide support for Integrated Windows, NTLM, or Kerberos authentication.

params.name: useragent
params.description: Text to put in the HTTP User-Agent request header field. Used to identify the request client software.
